alert.note: Alert for Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 6:43PM CST until January 03 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Bullock, Macon and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 643 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuskegee, Meadville, Hardaway, Franklin Field, Liverpool, Shopton, Davisville, Lake Tuskegee, Pine Level, Tuskegee National Forest, Dublin, Ramer, Mitchell, Fort Davis, Simsville, Warriorstand and Currys.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
